solution_line_template: There are twice as many frogs as dogs in the compound, meaning there are {frogs}/{ratio_frogs_to_dogs} = <<{frogs}/{ratio_frogs_to_dogs}={dogs}>>{dogs} dogs.
The total number of frogs and dogs in the compound is {dogs}+{frogs} = <<{dogs}+{frogs}={total_frogs_and_dogs}>>{total_frogs_and_dogs}

The number of cats is less than {cat_percentage_less} of the number of dogs, which means there are {cat_percentage_less}*{dogs} = <<{cat_percentage_less}*{dogs}={cat_reduction_amount}>>{cat_reduction_amount} dogs more than the number of cats.
Therefore, the number of cats is {dogs}-{cat_reduction_amount} = <<{dogs}-{cat_reduction_amount}={cats}>>{cats} cats
The total number of animals in the compound is {cats} cats +{total_frogs_and_dogs} dogs and frogs = <<{cats}+{total_frogs_and_dogs}={total_animals}>>{total_animals} animals.
